title: Life Expectancy versus GDP
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.

# Install packages
!pip install pandas gapminder

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

Requirement already satisfied: pandas in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (1.4.4)
Requirement already satisfied: gapminder in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (0.1)
Requirement already satisfied: pytz>=2020.1 in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from pandas) (2022.1)
Requirement already satisfied: numpy>=1.18.5 in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from pandas) (1.24.4)
Requirement already satisfied: python-dateutil>=2.8.1 in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from pandas) (2.8.2)
Requirement already satisfied: six>=1.5 in c:\users\mirac\anaconda3\lib\site-packages (from python-dateutil>=2.8.1->pandas) (1.16.0)



import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# data = pd.read_csv(r'C:\Users\mirac\Documents\GitHub\qtm350\qtm350-quiz01\data\input-data.csv')

plt.plot(gapminder_df["gdp_per_capita"], gapminder_df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("GDP per capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("GDP vs. Life Expectancy")

plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and countriesâ€™ populations.

# Install packages
!pip install pandas gapminder

# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

import numpy as np
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# data = pd.read_csv(r'C:\Users\mirac\Documents\GitHub\qtm350\qtm350-quiz01\data\input-data.csv')

plt.plot(gapminder_df["population_millions"], gapminder_df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.ylabel("Population (millions)")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs. Population")

plt.show()
